dpo_translation: Bhagavatī, essence of the perfection of wisdom!
ref_translation: The Heart of the Perfection of Wisdom, the Blessed Mother

dpo_translation: In the language of India: Bhagavatīprajñāpāramitāhṛdaya.
ref_translation: In the language of India: Bhagavatī prajñāpāramitā hṛdaya

dpo_translation: In the Tibetan language: Bhagavatī Prajñāpāramitāhṛdaya.
ref_translation: In the language of Tibet: Homage to the Perfection of Wisdom, the Blessed Mother!

dpo_translation: One section.
ref_translation: In a single segment.

dpo_translation: Thus have I heard at one time. The Blessed One was dwelling on Vulture Peak Mountain in Rājagṛha together with a great saṅgha of monks and a great saṅgha of bodhisattvas.
ref_translation: Thus did I hear at one time.The Blessed One was residing on Vulture Peak Mountain at Rājagṛha together with a great saṅgha of monks and a great saṅgha of bodhisattvas.

dpo_translation: At that time, the Blessed One entered the absorption known as the Dharma discourse called the Appearance of the Profound.
ref_translation: At that time the Blessed One rested in an absorption on the categories of phenomena called illumination of the profound.

dpo_translation: At that time, the bodhisattva great being noble Avalokiteśvara was looking at the profound conduct of the perfection of insight.
ref_translation: At the same time, the bodhisattva great being, noble Avalokiteśvara, while practicing the profound perfection of wisdom, looked and saw that the five aggregates are also empty of an intrinsic nature.

dpo_translation: They should also view the five aggregates as empty of inherent existence.
ref_translation: At the same time, the bodhisattva great being, noble Avalokiteśvara, while practicing the profound perfection of wisdom, looked and saw that the five aggregates are also empty of an intrinsic nature.

dpo_translation: Then, through the power of the Buddha, Venerable Śāriputra asked the great bodhisattva noble Avalokiteśvara, "How should one practice the profound perfection of wisdom?"
ref_translation: Then, due to the Buddha’s power, venerable Śāriputra asked the bodhisattva great being, noble Avalokiteśvara,

dpo_translation: Noble son, how should those who wish to practice the conduct of the profound perfection of wisdom train?"
ref_translation: “How should sons of noble family or daughters of noble family train if they wish to engage in the practice of the profound perfection of wisdom?”

dpo_translation: When he had said this, the bodhisattva great being noble Avalokiteśvara said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra, "Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the Tathāgata has not said that.
ref_translation: The bodhisattva great being, noble Avalokiteśvara, replied to venerable Śāradvatīputra,

dpo_translation: Śāriputra, any noble son or noble daughter who wishes to practice the profound conduct of the perfection of wisdom should view it in this way.
ref_translation: “Śāriputra, sons of noble family or daughters of noble family who wish to engage in the practice of the profound perfection of wisdom should see things in this way:

dpo_translation: They should also correctly perceive the five aggregates as empty of inherent existence.
ref_translation: they should correctly observe the five aggregates to be empty of an intrinsic nature.

dpo_translation: Form is empty.
ref_translation: “Form is empty.

dpo_translation: Emptiness is form.
ref_translation: Emptiness is form.

dpo_translation: Emptiness is not other than form.
ref_translation: Emptiness is not other than form, and form is also not other than emptiness.

dpo_translation: Emptiness is not other than form.
ref_translation: Emptiness is not other than form, and form is also not other than emptiness.

dpo_translation: Likewise, feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness are empty.
ref_translation: In the same way, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are empty.

dpo_translation: Therefore, Śāriputra, all phenomena are emptiness.
ref_translation: “Śāriputra, therefore, all phenomena are emptiness;

dpo_translation: It is without characteristics.
ref_translation: they are without characteristics, unborn, unceasing, without stains, without absence of stains, not deficient, and not complete.

dpo_translation: It is unborn.
ref_translation: they are without characteristics, unborn, unceasing, without stains, without absence of stains, not deficient, and not complete.

dpo_translation: Aniruddha,
ref_translation: they are without characteristics, unborn, unceasing, without stains, without absence of stains, not deficient, and not complete.

dpo_translation: Stainless.
ref_translation: they are without characteristics, unborn, unceasing, without stains, without absence of stains, not deficient, and not complete.

dpo_translation: It is without impurities.
ref_translation: they are without characteristics, unborn, unceasing, without stains, without absence of stains, not deficient, and not complete.

dpo_translation: It is without diminution.
ref_translation: they are without characteristics, unborn, unceasing, without stains, without absence of stains, not deficient, and not complete.

dpo_translation: It is not full.
ref_translation: they are without characteristics, unborn, unceasing, without stains, without absence of stains, not deficient, and not complete.

dpo_translation: Śāriputra, therefore, there is no form in emptiness.
ref_translation: “Śāriputra, therefore, in emptiness there is no form,

dpo_translation: There is no sensation.
ref_translation: no feeling,

dpo_translation: They have no perception.
ref_translation: no perception,

dpo_translation: There are no formations.
ref_translation: no formations,

dpo_translation: There is no consciousness.
ref_translation: no consciousness,

dpo_translation: They have no eyes.
ref_translation: no eye,

dpo_translation: They have no ears.
ref_translation: no ear,

dpo_translation: It is without a nose.
ref_translation: no nose,

dpo_translation: They have no tongues.
ref_translation: no tongue,

dpo_translation: It is without body.
ref_translation: no body,

dpo_translation: There is no mind.
ref_translation: no mind,

dpo_translation: It is formless.
ref_translation: no form,

dpo_translation: It is without sound.
ref_translation: no sound,

dpo_translation: Stainless.
ref_translation: no smell,

dpo_translation: It has no taste.
ref_translation: no taste,

dpo_translation: There is no tactile sensation.
ref_translation: no texture,

dpo_translation: There are no phenomena.
ref_translation: no mental object.

dpo_translation: There is no visual element, and there is no mental element.
ref_translation: “There is no element of the eye, up to no element of the mind, and

dpo_translation: The sensory element of mental consciousness does not exist.
ref_translation: further up to no element of the mind consciousness.

dpo_translation: There is no ignorance.
ref_translation: “There is no ignorance

dpo_translation: There is no extinction of ignorance, and so on, up to and including no extinction of old age and death.
ref_translation: no exhaustion of ignorance, up to no aging and death

dpo_translation: There is no birth, aging, and death.
ref_translation: no exhaustion of aging and death.

dpo_translation: There is no suffering, origin, cessation, or path.
ref_translation: “There is no suffering, no origin of suffering, no cessation of suffering, no path,

dpo_translation: There is no wisdom.
ref_translation: no wisdom,

dpo_translation: There is no attainment.
ref_translation: no attainment,

dpo_translation: There is no nonattainment.
ref_translation: no nonattainment.

dpo_translation: Śāriputra, bodhisattvas do not attain anything.
ref_translation: “Śāriputra, therefore, since bodhisattvas have no attainment,

dpo_translation: They rely on the perfection of wisdom.
ref_translation: they rely upon and dwell in the perfection of wisdom.

dpo_translation: They abide in the state of a bodhisattva.
ref_translation: “Śāriputra, therefore, since bodhisattvas have no attainment, they rely upon and dwell in the perfection of wisdom.

dpo_translation: Since their minds are free from obscurations, they are fearless.
ref_translation: Because their minds have no veils, they have no fear. Having utterly gone beyond error, they reach the culmination of nirvāṇa.

dpo_translation: They have transcended all error.
ref_translation: Because their minds have no veils, they have no fear. Having utterly gone beyond error, they reach the culmination of nirvāṇa.

dpo_translation: They will reach the end of nirvāṇa.
ref_translation: Because their minds have no veils, they have no fear. Having utterly gone beyond error, they reach the culmination of nirvāṇa.

dpo_translation: All the buddhas who dwell in the three times also rely on the perfection of wisdom.
ref_translation: “All the buddhas who reside in the three times have likewise fully awakened to unsurpassed and perfect awakening by relying upon the perfection of wisdom.

dpo_translation: He attained the highest, most complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.
ref_translation: “All the buddhas who reside in the three times have likewise fully awakened to unsurpassed and perfect awakening by relying upon the perfection of wisdom.

dpo_translation: Therefore, the mantra of the perfection of wisdom is: 'om gate gate paragate parasamgate bodhi soha.'
ref_translation: “Therefore, the mantra of the perfection of wisdom is the mantra of great knowledge, the unsurpassed mantra, the mantra that is equal to the unequaled, and the mantra that utterly pacifies all suffering.

dpo_translation: The mantra of great knowledge.
ref_translation: “Therefore, the mantra of the perfection of wisdom is the mantra of great knowledge, the unsurpassed mantra, the mantra that is equal to the unequaled, and the mantra that utterly pacifies all suffering.

dpo_translation: It is the unexcelled mantra.
ref_translation: “Therefore, the mantra of the perfection of wisdom is the mantra of great knowledge, the unsurpassed mantra, the mantra that is equal to the unequaled, and the mantra that utterly pacifies all suffering.

dpo_translation: The mantra of the unequalled is the mantra of the unequalled.
ref_translation: “Therefore, the mantra of the perfection of wisdom is the mantra of great knowledge, the unsurpassed mantra, the mantra that is equal to the unequaled, and the mantra that utterly pacifies all suffering.

dpo_translation: It is the mantra that pacifies all suffering.
ref_translation: “Therefore, the mantra of the perfection of wisdom is the mantra of great knowledge, the unsurpassed mantra, the mantra that is equal to the unequaled, and the mantra that utterly pacifies all suffering.

dpo_translation: Since they are not false, they should be understood to be true.
ref_translation: Since it is not false, it should be known to be true.

dpo_translation: The mantra of the perfection of wisdom was spoken.
ref_translation: “The mantra of the perfection of wisdom is stated thus:

dpo_translation: Tadyathā | gate gate pāragate | pārasaṃgate | bodhi svāhā
ref_translation: tadyathā gate gate pāragate pārasaṃgate bodhi svāhā

dpo_translation: Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings should train in the profound perfection of wisdom in that way."
ref_translation: “Śāriputra, this is the way a bodhisattva great being should train in the profound perfection of wisdom.”

dpo_translation: Then the Blessed One arose from that samādhi.
ref_translation: Then the Blessed One arose from that absorption and gave his approval to the bodhisattva great being, noble Avalokiteśvara, saying, “Excellent! Excellent!

dpo_translation: The bodhisattva mahāsattva gave the noble Avalokiteśvara a gift of praise.
ref_translation: Then the Blessed One arose from that absorption and gave his approval to the bodhisattva great being, noble Avalokiteśvara, saying, “Excellent! Excellent!

dpo_translation: Excellent! Excellent!
ref_translation: Then the Blessed One arose from that absorption and gave his approval to the bodhisattva great being, noble Avalokiteśvara, saying, “Excellent! Excellent!

dpo_translation: Noble son, it is so.
ref_translation: Son of noble family, it is like that.

dpo_translation: Noble son, it is so.
ref_translation: Son of noble family, it is like that.

dpo_translation: I will practice the profound perfection of wisdom as you have taught me."
ref_translation: The profound perfection of wisdom should be practiced just as you have taught, and even the thus-gone ones will rejoice.”

dpo_translation: The tathāgatas also rejoice.
ref_translation: The profound perfection of wisdom should be practiced just as you have taught, and even the thus-gone ones will rejoice.”

dpo_translation: After the Blessed One had said this,
ref_translation: When the Blessed One had said this, venerable Śāradvatīputra, the bodhisattva great being, noble Avalokiteśvara, and the entire assembly, as well as the world with its devas, humans, asuras, and gandharvas, rejoiced and praised what the Blessed One had said.

dpo_translation: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the bodhisattva great being Avalokiteśvara, and the entire assembly, as well as the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas, rejoiced.
ref_translation: When the Blessed One had said this, venerable Śāradvatīputra, the bodhisattva great being, noble Avalokiteśvara, and the entire assembly, as well as the world with its devas, humans, asuras, and gandharvas, rejoiced and praised what the Blessed One had said.

dpo_translation: They praised the words of the Blessed One.
ref_translation: When the Blessed One had said this, venerable Śāradvatīputra, the bodhisattva great being, noble Avalokiteśvara, and the entire assembly, as well as the world with its devas, humans, asuras, and gandharvas, rejoiced and praised what the Blessed One had said.

dpo_translation: This concludes the Mahāyāna sūtra called The Heart of the Perfection of Wisdom.
ref_translation: This completes The Great Vehicle Sūtra “The Heart of the Perfection of Wisdom, the Blessed Mother.”
